description: Systematic investigation of diagnostic biases in celiac disease detection, including verification bias, overlooked populations, and guideline limitations

usage.instructions: Fetch files by appending the filename to the base_url.

1_verification_bias_serology.title: Verification Bias & Serology Accuracy
1_verification_bias_serology.description: Core evidence that verification bias inflates reported IgA-tTG2 sensitivity

1.1.title: Verification Bias in IgA-tTG2 Testing
1.1.key_finding: Sensitivity drops from 93% to 57% after bias correction

2_biopsy_interpretation.title: Biopsy Interpretation Biases
2_biopsy_interpretation.description: Evidence that biopsy is an imperfect gold standard with significant inter-observer variability

2.1.title: Pathologist Agreement on Histopathology
2.1.key_finding: κ=0.33 for Marsh 3A; 41% called normal by community pathologists

2.4A1.title: Marsh 3A Pathobiology
2.4A1.key_finding: Marsh 3A is the diagnostic blind spot

2.4A2.title: Biomarkers for Seronegative CD at Marsh 3A
2.4A2.key_finding: γδ IEL 87% sensitivity in seronegative VA

3_overlooked_populations.title: Systematically Missed Populations
3_overlooked_populations.description: Patient populations systematically underdiagnosed by current algorithms

3.1.title: Seronegative Celiac Disease Synthesis
3.1.key_finding: SNCD is 2-6% of diagnosed CD; 10.9× complication rate

3.2.title: Rare HLA Types and Diagnostic Invisibility

3.3.title: Marsh 1-2 and Potential Celiac Disease
3.3.key_finding: 43% of potential CD progresses to villous atrophy

3.4.title: IgA Deficiency in Celiac Disease
3.4.key_finding: IgG test sensitivity unknown due to verification bias

3.5.title: Secretory IgA and Mucosal Immunity
3.5.key_finding: Serum IgA ≠ secretory IgA; dissociation possible

3.7.title: Racial and Ethnic Bias in CD Diagnosis

3.8.title: Diagnostic Failure in Patients on GFD
3.8.key_finding: 72% of GFD followers lack formal CD diagnosis

3.10.title: CD and IBS Diagnostic Overlap
3.10.key_finding: 2-5% of IBS has CD; only 2.7% tested

5_guideline_assumptions.title: Unproven Guideline Assumptions
5_guideline_assumptions.description: Challenging foundational assumptions in clinical guidelines

5.1.title: The 95%+ Sensitivity Claim
5.1.key_finding: Claim traces to subset of 3 studies from 2005

6_disease_spectrum.title: Disease Spectrum & Alternatives
6_disease_spectrum.description: Understanding CD as a spectrum and alternative diagnostic approaches

6.1.title: CD Subtypes and Spectrum Model
6.1.key_finding: One T-cell disease with variable antibody expression

6.3.title: No-Biopsy Diagnosis in Adults
6.3.key_finding: Only 8-32% of adults qualify for no-biopsy pathway

7.2.title: Guideline Critique
7.2.key_finding: Major guidelines contain multiple unsupported claims

8_monitoring_classification.title: Monitoring & Classification
8_monitoring_classification.description: Issues with disease monitoring and histological classification

8.1.title: DGP and HLA in Monitoring
8.1.key_finding: DGP may outperform tTG2 in some contexts

8.2.title: IgG1 Subclass Deficiency
8.2.key_finding: IgG1 deficiency impairs all serology pathways

8.4.title: GFD Monitoring Limitations
8.4.key_finding: Serology only 50% sensitive for persistent VA

9_extraintestinal.title: Extraintestinal Manifestations
9_extraintestinal.description: Neurological and thyroid manifestations of gluten autoimmunity

9.1.title: Neurological Gluten Spectrum
9.1.key_finding: 40% of CD has anti-tTG6; gluten ataxia is ~15% of sporadic ataxias

9.2.title: Thyroid-Celiac Autoimmune Connection
9.2.key_finding: 10-30% of CD has autoimmune thyroid disease
